commit.message: Add consistent '@throws IOException if an error occurs' tags to all methods throwing IOException

Revert "Remove @throws as per review feedback"

This reverts commit 623d37496cdfd7b1dd45fbaadda1df8b718be36d.
Remove @throws as per review feedback
Consistently use the term "END header" when referring to the "End of central directory record".
Remove "the the" repetition

Add a third DEFLATED entry to the test ZIP. Look up CEN offset from END header instead of skipping LOC headers. Add asserts that verifies that the ZIP has the expected entries. Write some data to the entry in the sample ZIP. Remove try/catch when opening ZipFile.
Merge branch 'master' into zip-too-many-entries
Inlining the openZip method makes the tests more explicit
Clean up potentially big files after test
Sparse files must be created explicitly on NTFS
Merge branch 'master' into zip-too-many-entries
Replace expectedExceptions annotations with expectThrows and assertEquals
Merge branch 'master' into zip-too-many-entries
Fix spelling in comment

Inflate the CEN size using sparse files such that it matches the size declared in the End of central directory record. Add a new test which verifies the rejection of too-large CEN offset. Revert the change to END validation in ZipFile which is no longer needed.
No need to pass template ZIP as parameter
Updates from review comments: put ZIP template in byte array, add comment referencing existing CenSizeTooLarge, clarify MAX_CEN_SIZE, use expectedExceptions and expectedExceptionsMessageRegExp
Revert changes to TestTooManyEntries and instead add a new test which runs fast and non-manual
Add a comment for the CEN size update
CEN size checking can be moved after the empty-ZIP check

Use ZipOutoutStream to create a real ZIP file, then update the CEN size to the wanted sizes. Remove the ZIP64 logic, since the purpose of the test is to verify rejection of CEN sizes too large, not where the CEN is found.
Merge branch 'master' into zip-too-many-entries
Style: Add a missing whitespace
Remove ZIP64 from the summary now that also regular ZIP file CEN sizes are checked
Fix copyright years
Update copyright year

Regular, non-ZIP64 files can also exceed the CEN size limit. Add test cases for regular CEN sizes exactly on and exceeding the limit. Move enforcement of the size limit back to initCEN, but before the short-circuiting of empty files.

Update TestTooManyEntries to create ZIP files containing only the "End of central directory" records. This removes the need to a create several GB big "real" ZIP64 file. To facilitate testing, the validation of CEN size > limit is moved from initCEN into findEnd. Since the test now runs fast, make it non-manual.
